attributes.action: voice unheard no right consultation when they come into.  power  into number 10 in May   2015 do not ignore abuse sweep under carpet
attributes.additional_details: This consultation that ends on 29th may for people with learning with disabilities we want political parties to be very committed to listening to our views and changing things for the better for people and their families and not ignoring abuse being sweep under the carpet for people with learning disabilities who either in assessment and treatment units which we want to see close the big Nhs and private sector ones that sir Simon Stevens announced and we want to improve our life's in community and change the way commissioning is done in future we need every political party to very much committed to this Progamme and take it seriously and change the law in mental health services and in the community where we live in our own homes we need to change the way local authorities and Nhs clinical commissioning are commissioning things right now to improve life's of people with learning disabilities we want the next government to put this at the top of agenda.
